private_information: I can move disks A B C D only
I represent one physical manipulator that may move only the top free disk when it is one of A B C D
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the global goal configuration is reached while only moving disks A B C D.

private_information: I can move disks E F G only
I represent one physical manipulator that may move only the top free disk when it is one of E F G
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the global goal configuration is reached while only moving disks E F G.

private_information: I can move disks H I J only
I represent one physical manipulator that may move only the top free disk when it is one of H I J
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so that the global goal configuration is reached while only moving disks H I J.

private_information: I coordinate the other agents and integrate their move fragments
I must produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem that targets the FastDownwards planner and that keeps agent actions distinct
orchestrator.goal: Assemble agent move fragments into a single valid Tower of Hanoi solution and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that encodes the multi-agent move constraints and the global goal.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi on three pegs labeled left middle right.
Disks are labeled A through J where A is the smallest and J is the largest.
Only the top disk of any peg may be moved.
A larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Each agent is allowed to move only a specific subset of disks: agent_1 can move A B C D, agent_2 can move E F G, agent_3 can move H I J.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and you may only move disks A B C D. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves consistent with the public information and your private restrictions. Use the exact primitive move format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks A B C D.
moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk movement restrictions. Focus only on moves involving disks A B C D. Do not emit PDDL. Each move must be a single line in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and you may only move disks E F G. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves consistent with the public information and your private restrictions. Use the exact primitive move format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks E F G.
moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk movement restrictions. Focus only on moves involving disks E F G. Do not emit PDDL. Each move must be a single line in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and you may only move disks H I J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves consistent with the public information and your private restrictions. Use the exact primitive move format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks H I J.
moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk movement restrictions. Focus only on moves involving disks H I J. Do not emit PDDL. Each move must be a single line in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the move fragments from agent_1 agent_2 and agent_3 into a single valid global execution that obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk restrictions. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that is directly targetable by the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Keep agent actions distinct and annotate which action belongs to which agent.
pddl.prompt: You will receive ordered primitive moves from the three agents. Validate and merge them into a single consistent sequence that achieves the global goal configuration. If fragments conflict, resolve conflicts by reordering moves while preserving each agent's disk movement constraint. After producing the final validated move sequence, output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that encodes the initial configuration, the goal configuration, the Tower of Hanoi rules, agent-specific action predicates, and the merged move sequence as a plan hint. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem>.
